comments:
Microbiology plays a central role in diverse areas of human life such as infectious
disease, ecology and biotechnology. This course covers aspects of modern microbiology
with an emphasis on prokaryotic organisms. The topics include, among others, basic
aspects of microbial diversity, genetics, virology and pathogenesis as well as examples of
applied microbiology.
The students felt that this was a “great course for introducing microbiology”. In
addition to Professor Pohlschroder, there were many guest lecturers. Although some
students felt that the guest lectures “made it hard to focus on the course’s central goals,”
the majority felt that the guest lectures added to the course, giving tips on in-depth
research and career options in microbiology. Overall, the students felt that this was an
“exciting and informative course.”
Students gave impressive reviews of Professor Pohlschroder. They said that she
was an “excellent teacher” with a “very positive attitude.” Students wished that Professor
Pohlschroder taught more of the lectures because she was a very entertaining lecturer and
presented the course material clearly.
The students felt that the exams were easy and very fair. The prerequisites for
this class are BIOL 101 and BIOL 121, while BIOL 221 is strongly recommended.
